name: 4 to 16 decoder
description:
A 4 to 16 decoder can be constructed from two 2 to 4 decoders. The input bits of the 4 to 16 decoder can be represented as two sets of 2 bits each, with the first set representing the most significant bits (MSBs) and the second set representing the least significant bits (LSBs).

The MSBs are fed as inputs to the first 2 to 4 decoder, which generates 4 outputs, each corresponding to one of the possible combinations of the MSB bits. These 4 outputs are then fed as select lines to the second 2 to 4 decoder. The LSBs are fed as inputs to both the first and second 2 to 4 decoders.

The second 2 to 4 decoder generates 4 outputs for each of the 4 select lines from the first decoder, resulting in a total of 16 outputs. Each output of the 4 to 16 decoder corresponds to a unique combination of the MSBs and LSBs.

Therefore, the 4 to 16 decoder can be seen as a two-level hierarchical arrangement of decoders, with the first level decoding the MSBs and the second level decoding the LSBs.
